content: colors and shapes play mat by allthingscrafte use this play mat to teach your kiddo how to match shapes and colors inspired by a pattern from lindsey dale on ravelry materials -worsted weight yarn in red orange yellow green blue and purple approximately 50 yards of each -size 7 4 5 mm crochet hook -tapestry needle -scissors -stitch marker key chain chain st stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet 2 together half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet magic_ring magic_ring blo back loop only notes -depending on your personal gauge you may want to adjust your hook size up or down for the shapes if warping occurs -some shapes fasten_off with an invisible join here is a tutorial from one dog woof if you need https //www 1dogwoof com/how-to-crochet- invisible-joins/ -stitch counts for each row are listed at the end in parentheses play mat make 1 of each panel panel 1 row 1 with red chain 22 double_crochet in 3rd st from hook double_crochet in each remaining chain turn at end of row 20 row 2-11 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across turn at end of row 20 row 12 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across for last st finish st with yellow pull through last two loops of final double_crochet with new color turn 20 row 13-23 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across turn at end of row 20 row 24 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across for last st finish st with blue pull through last two loops of final double_crochet with new color turn 20 row 25-36 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across turn at end of row 20 do not turn at end of last row and do not fasten_off set aside panel 2 row 1 with orange chain 22 double_crochet in 3rd st from hook double_crochet in each remaining chain turn at end of row 20 row 2-11 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across turn at end of row 20 row 12 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across for last st finish st with green pull through last two loops of final double_crochet with new color turn 20 row 13-23 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across turn at end of row 20 row 24 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across for last st finish st with purple pull through last two loops of final double_crochet with new color turn 20 row 25-36 chain 2 double_crochet in each st across turn at end of row 20 do not turn at end of last row and do not fasten_off set aside finishing complete instructions with each panel re-insert hook into last loop of panel chain 1 and turn your work so you re going down the long side *in side of first double_crochet decrease in side of next double_crochet work 2 single_crochet not in the same spot * repeat from * to * changing colors when needed to match next block and doing
